intro: Cadetia maideniana, commonly known as the Maureen's cadetia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
